questions.question: 毎日　こうえん（＿）　さんぽします。
questions.hint:
Grammar Help:

～で - location of an action

さんぽする - to take a walk

explanation.correct:
Correct! 🎉

「こうえんでさんぽします」 means “I take a walk in the park.”

  • に - indicates direction or time
  • を - marks the object, not place
  • が - subject marker
explanation.incorrect:
Incorrect Answer

The correct answer is で.

  • に - indicates direction or time
  • を - marks the object, not place
  • が - subject marker

questions.question: 日曜日（＿）　ともだちに　あいました。
questions.hint:
Grammar Help:

～に 会う - to meet on a specific day or time

日曜日 - Sunday

explanation.correct:
Correct! 🎉

「日曜日に会いました」 means “I met (someone) on Sunday.”

  • が - subject marker
  • を - object marker
  • と - “with,” not correct for time marker
explanation.incorrect:
Incorrect Answer

The correct answer is に.

  • が - subject marker
  • を - object marker
  • と - “with,” not correct for time marker

questions.question: このみせは　にちようび（＿）　しまっています。
questions.hint:
Grammar Help:

～に 閉まっています - to be closed on a specific day

にちようび - Sunday

explanation.correct:
Correct! 🎉

「日曜日にしまっています」 means “It’s closed on Sundays.”

  • が - subject marker
  • を - object marker
  • は - topic marker, but not correct for time
explanation.incorrect:
Incorrect Answer

The correct answer is に.

  • が - subject marker
  • を - object marker
  • は - topic marker, but not correct for time

questions.question: 先生（＿）　しつもんを　ききました。
questions.hint:
Grammar Help:

～に 聞く - to ask someone a question

しつもん - question

explanation.correct:
Correct! 🎉

「先生に聞きました」 means “I asked the teacher.”

  • で - place marker
  • を - object marker
  • が - subject marker
explanation.incorrect:
Incorrect Answer

The correct answer is に.

  • で - place marker
  • を - object marker
  • が - subject marker

questions.question: いま　ともだち（＿）　でんわを　しています。
questions.hint:
Grammar Help:

～と - with someone

でんわする - to call someone

explanation.correct:
Correct! 🎉

「ともだちとでんわしています」 means “I’m on the phone with my friend.”

  • を - object marker
  • に - direction/target marker
  • が - subject marker
explanation.incorrect:
Incorrect Answer

The correct answer is と.

  • を - object marker
  • に - direction/target marker
  • が - subject marker
